channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fears of a recession are rising as stocks turn down and Trump continues to press tariffs
item.description: Fears of a downturn are rising as investors, economists, and business executives are realizing that Trump's import taxes are much more at the forefron...

item.title: Financial performance may have been flat but some CEO payouts are soaring as bonuses roar back
item.description: Bonuses are bouncing back from last year despite flat financial performance as some companies work to keep top talent from fleeing.

item.title: American steel knife company hit by Canadian customer anger as Trump tariffs arrive: ‘Thank you. We love your product. We are not buying’

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs on Steel and Aluminum Take Effect
item.description: President Trump imposed a 25 percent tariff on metal imports. The move is expected to raise costs for U.S. manufacturers of cars, solar panels and oth...

item.title: Kurdish Fighters Called a Truce, but Turkey Kept Up Lethal Strikes
item.description: Turkey is still bombing armed Kurdish insurgents in Iraq and Syria, even after their leader urged them to lay down their arms and disband, and their g...

item.title: Students in Serbia Lead Marches to Demand Systemic Change
item.description: The antigovernment protests began in late 2024, calling for accountability for the collapse of a concrete canopy at a railway station in northern Serb...

item.title: Chinese Warships Circle Australia and Leave It Feeling ‘Near Naked’
item.description: The unusual deployment by three navy ships over the past month has prompted a debate in Australia about its aging fleet and reliance on the United Sta...

item.title: Three Opinion Writers Assess the Damage of Trump’s First 50 Days
item.description: Michelle Goldberg and Frank Bruni join Patrick Healy to discuss the issues that have defined Trump’s presidency thus far.

item.title: Health care for more than 100 million Americans is being turned over to a supplement salesman
item.description: President Donald Trump’s health team has deep financial ties to the supplements industry. Now they’re poised to boost its growth and remake the govern...

item.title: Europe Retaliates Against Trump’s Tariffs as Trade Fight Widens
item.description: The European Union responded to American steel and aluminum tariffs with its own tariffs on boats and bourbon — and pledges of more to come.

item.title: Musk Email Reaches Italian Workers. It Did Not Go Well.

item.title: Online Influencer Is Killed While Livestreaming in Tokyo
item.description: Police in Japan have charged a man with the murder, saying he was a follower who had tracked her location by the buildings behind her as she filmed he...

item.title: In Trump’s Shadow, Greenland Votes for a New Government
item.description: President Trump has expressed a desire to “get” Greenland, but the party that won Tuesday’s election is in no rush to change the status quo.

item.title: China needs to unleash ‘$20 trillion’ in household savings to drive economic growth, says Alibaba chair Joe Tsai

item.title: An Unexpected Trump Bump for the World’s Centrists
item.description: As President Trump’s “shock and awe” policies radiate around the world, they are galvanizing support for moderate leaders and unifying Europe.
